title: Where to Find a USPS Tracking Number

steps.title: Look on your post office shipping receipt.
steps.content: Look on your post office shipping receipt. When you visit the post office in person and mail your package at the counter, they will give you a receipt for your purchase. You can find your USPS tracking number printed at the bottom of your sales receipt. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Look on your insurance receipt.
steps.content: Look on your insurance receipt. If your package was valued at more than $50 USD, you may have purchased additional shipping insurance. If so, you would have received an additional receipt for this. Your USPS tracking number can be found at the bottom of your insurance receipt. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Check your email for a confirmation from USPS.com.
steps.content: Check your email for a confirmation from USPS.com. If you shipped your package using USPS.com, you should have received an email confirmation. Contained within this email, you can find your tracking number. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Check your email for a shipping confirmation from an online retailer.
steps.content: Check your email for a shipping confirmation from an online retailer. If you made a purchase through an online retailer, and they shipped your package with the United States Postal Service, they should have emailed you a shipping confirmation. Within this email, you should be able to find your tracking number. [4] X Research source If you did not receive a confirmation email, you may want to contact the retailer directly.

steps.title: Examine the bottom peel-off portion of a USPS tracking label.
steps.content: Examine the bottom peel-off portion of a USPS tracking label. When you ship a package in person at the post office, the clerk will peel off a sticker with a barcode and paste it onto your package. They will then hand you the bottom portion of that peel-off label. This will have your USPS tracking number at the bottom. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Flip over the orange slip you received if you missed a delivery.
steps.content: Flip over the orange slip you received if you missed a delivery. If you were not home to receive a package, you should find an orange slip in your mailbox or attached to your front door. This orange slip will include info about how to retrieve your package. On the back of this orange slip, you can find your USPS tracking number.

steps.title: Jot down your tracking number.
steps.content: Jot down your tracking number. Write your tracking number down in a safe place. Depending on the type of shipping that was used, a tracking number can look a little bit different. [6] X Research source Here is a list of USPS services offered and sample tracking numbers for each: USPS Tracking - 9400 1000 0000 0000 0000 00 Priority Mail - 9205 5000 0000 0000 0000 00 Certified Mail - 9407 3000 0000 0000 0000 00 Collect On Delivery Hold For Pickup - 9303 3000 0000 0000 0000 00 Global Express Guaranteed - 82 000 000 00 Priority Mail Express International - EC 000 000 000 US Priority Mail Express - 9270 1000 0000 0000 0000 00 Priority Mail International - CP 000 000 000 US Registered Mail - 9208 8000 0000 0000 0000 00 Signature Confirmation - 9202 1000 0000 0000 0000 00

steps.title: Visit the USPS website.
steps.content: Visit the USPS website. Go to https://www.usps.com/ , manually enter your tracking number in the space provided, and click “Track Package.” A new page will open providing information about when and where you package was sent, where it is now, and when it will be delivered. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Call the USPS.
steps.content: Call the USPS. If the online form is not working, you don't have internet access, or you have additional questions, contact the USPS by phone. Call 1-800-275-8777 and choose “Track a Package” from the automated menu. [8] X Research source You can also stop by a post office and speak to someone in person.
